member.name: T:CrawfisSoftware.PCG.BitEnumerators
member.summary: Two static utility methods for enumerating Bit patterns, plus an additional set-up method that can be used to trade-off memory versus computation. If performance is an issue, users should call ExpandPreComputedTables before calling AllOdd or AllEven.

member.name: M:CrawfisSoftware.PCG.BitEnumerators.AllEven(System.Int32)
member.summary: Algorithm to iterate over all bit patterns up to the specified width that have an even number of 1's.
member.param: The number of bits in the patterns. Must be less than 31.
member.returns: An enumerated stream of ints, where each value has an even number of 1's.
member.remarks: This method is NP in runtime, as is the number of return values!

member.name: M:CrawfisSoftware.PCG.BitEnumerators.AllOdd(System.Int32)
member.summary: Algorithm to iterate over all bit patterns up to the specified width that have an odd number of 1's.
member.param: The number of bits in the patterns. Must be less than 31.
member.returns: An enumerated stream of ints, where each value has an odd number of 1's.
member.remarks: This method is NP in runtime, as is the number of return values!

member.name: M:CrawfisSoftware.PCG.BitEnumerators.ExpandPreComputedTables(System.Int32)
member.summary: Precompute the enumeration for small N.
member.param: The size of the precomputed pattern you wish to precompute. Due to CLR array size limits, this value is clamped to 28.
member.remarks: This algorithm is 1) NP in run time and 2) NP in memory!

member.name: M:CrawfisSoftware.PCG.BitEnumerators.PopCount(System.UInt32)
member.summary: Returns the population count (number of bits set) of a mask. Similar in behavior to the x86 instruction POPCNT.
member.param: The value.

member.name: T:CrawfisSoftware.PCG.CellularAutomata
member.summary: Framework for creating false/true (0/1) grids.

member.name: F:CrawfisSoftware.PCG.CellularAutomata._occupancyGridFrontBuffer
member.summary: An OccupancyGrid that is used as the front buffer.

member.name: F:CrawfisSoftware.PCG.CellularAutomata._occupancyGridBackBuffer
member.summary: An OccupancyGrid that is used as the back buffer.

member.name: F:CrawfisSoftware.PCG.CellularAutomata.randomGenerator
member.summary: A random number generator.

member.name: P:CrawfisSoftware.PCG.CellularAutomata.Width
member.summary: Get the number of columns in the cellular automata

member.name: P:CrawfisSoftware.PCG.CellularAutomata.Height
member.summary: Get the number of rows in the cellular automata

member.name: P:CrawfisSoftware.PCG.CellularAutomata.NeighborhoodSize
member.summary: Get or set the neighborhood radius. Default is one.

member.name: P:CrawfisSoftware.PCG.CellularAutomata.AutomataForTrueCells
member.summary: Get or set the function that takes the number of neighbors and the number of those that are true (1) and return true or false
member.remarks: Called if the current cell is true.

member.name: P:CrawfisSoftware.PCG.CellularAutomata.AutomataForFalseCells
member.summary: Get or set the function that takes the number of neighbors and the number of those that are true (1) and return true or false
member.remarks: Called if the current cell is false.

member.name: P:CrawfisSoftware.PCG.CellularAutomata.PreIterationFunc
member.summary: Get or set the function called before each iteration

member.name: P:CrawfisSoftware.PCG.CellularAutomata.PostIterationFunc
member.summary: Get or set the function called after each iteration

member.name: M:CrawfisSoftware.PCG.CellularAutomata.#ctor(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Random)
member.summary: Constructor.
member.param: The number of columns.
The number of rows.
A random number generator. If null, a new one will be created.

member.name: M:CrawfisSoftware.PCG.CellularAutomata.#ctor(CrawfisSoftware.Collections.Graph.OccupancyGrid,System.Random)
member.summary: Constructor.
member.param: An initial occupancy grid to use.
A random number generator. If null, a new one will be created.

member.name: M:CrawfisSoftware.PCG.CellularAutomata.AddTrueNoise(System.Single)
member.summary: Utility function to initialize or add noise.
member.param: Values above this threshold will be set to true.

member.name: M:CrawfisSoftware.PCG.CellularAutomata.AddFalseNoise(System.Single)
member.summary: Utility function to initialize or add noise.
member.param: Values above this threshold will be set to false.

member.name: M:CrawfisSoftware.PCG.CellularAutomata.IterateAutomata(System.Int32)
member.summary: Apply the automata rules repeatedly.
member.param: The number of times to apply the automata.

member.name: M:CrawfisSoftware.PCG.CellularAutomata.GetOccupancyGrid
member.summary: Return the OccupancyGrid of the cellular automata

member.name: M:CrawfisSoftware.PCG.CellularAutomata.GetNeighborsAndCount(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Count the total number of neighbors under the cell with a box of NeighborhoodSize. Also count the number of those cells that are true.
member.param: The center column.
The center row.
Outputs the number of true values under the kernel.
member.returns: Outputs the total number of cells under the kernel. This will be the kernel size except near boundaries.
member.exception: Throws an exception if the filter size or column / row are wrong.

member.name: M:CrawfisSoftware.PCG.CellularAutomata.ToString
member.summary: Converts the Cellular Automata to an asci string representation
member.returns: A string

member.name: T:CrawfisSoftware.PCG.CellularAutomataExtended
member.summary: CellularAutomata that allows a Kernel to be passed in. This allows for the N-neighbors, weights, etc. where the original algorithm is a box filter / counter.

member.name: P:CrawfisSoftware.PCG.CellularAutomataExtended.KernelWeights
member.summary: Get or set the kernel weights. These values will be added together for those cells that are true.

member.name: P:CrawfisSoftware.PCG.CellularAutomataExtended.ComputeCell
member.summary: The Predicate Function that determines whether to change the cell. It takes in parameters as in the example: private static bool AlwaysTrue(int column, int row, int iteration, int numberTrue, int numberOfNeighbors)

member.name: M:CrawfisSoftware.PCG.CellularAutomataExtended.#ctor(CrawfisSoftware.Collections.Graph.OccupancyGrid,System.Random)
member.summary: Constructor.
member.param: An initial state for the cellular automata.
An optional random number generator.

member.name: M:CrawfisSoftware.PCG.CellularAutomataExtended.#ctor(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Random)
member.summary: Constructor.
member.param: The number of columns for the new occupancy grid.
The number of rows for the new occupancy grid.
An optional random number generator.

member.name: M:CrawfisSoftware.PCG.CellularAutomataExtended.IterateFiltered(System.Int32)
member.summary: Iterate over the grid the specified number of times, computing the convolution of the kernel with the occupancy grid and calling the ComputeCell function.
member.param: The number of times to apply the decision process for each cell.

member.name: M:CrawfisSoftware.PCG.CellularAutomataExtended.GetFilteredValue(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32@,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Applies the convolution.
member.param: The center column.
The center row.
Outputs the number of true values under the kernel.
Outputs the total number of cells under the kernel. This will be the kernel size except near boundaries.
member.returns: The summation of the kernel values where the cells are true.
member.exception: Throws an exception if the filter size or column / row are wrong.

member.name: T:CrawfisSoftware.PCG.EnumerationUtilities
member.summary: Static class to provide some useful enumeration utilities.

member.name: T:CrawfisSoftware.PCG.EnumerationUtilities.Validator
member.summary: Defines a function that takes in the state of the Path enumeration including a possible new row or vertical bits and returns true if the user wants to allow it, false otherwise. This is useful to define constraints on thepath enumeration.
member.param: A unique pathID for each path being enumerated.
The index of the row currently being enumerated.
The candiate vertical bits to accept or reject.
The state of the vertical paths up to this row index.
The state of the horizontal paths up to this row index.
The state of the components up to this row index.
member.returns: True if this row should be included in the enumeration. False otherwise.

member.name: M:CrawfisSoftware.PCG.EnumerationUtilities.ValidateAndUpdateComponents(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Collections.Generic.IList{System.Collections.Generic.IList{System.Int32}},System.Int32,System.Int32@,System.Int32)
member.summary: Checks two rows to see if they are valid. If so, components from the first row are matched (or merged) and new component numbers are created (as well as new loops).
member.param: Incoming row of vertical edges
Outgoing row of vertical edges
The verticalGrid of component numbers for each inflow edge on each row
The current row index
A bit vector of new horizontal edges created by the component matching, merging and creation
A constraint to check on the maximum allowed nested loops for this row.
member.returns: True is the outFlows row is a valid row based on the inFlows row.

member.name: M:CrawfisSoftware.PCG.EnumerationUtilities.ValidateAndUpdateComponentsCarryOverBit(System.Numerics.BigInteger,System.Numerics.BigInteger,System.Collections.Generic.IList{System.Collections.Generic.IList{System.Int32}},System.Int32,System.Numerics.BigInteger@,System.Int32)
member.summary: Checks two rows to see if they are valid. If so, components from the first row are matched (or merged) and new component numbers are created (as well as new loops).
member.param: Incoming row of vertical edges
Outgoing row of vertical edges
The verticalGrid of component numbers for each inflow edge on each row
The current row index
A bit vector of new horizontal edges created by the component matching, merging and creation
A constraint to check on the maximum allowed nested loops for this row.
member.returns: True is the outFlows row is a valid row based on the inFlows row.

member.summary: Trim the bit pattern to the span between start and end (inclusive)

member.summary: Count the number of set bits in the bit pattern

member.name: T:CrawfisSoftware.PCG.LoopEnumerator
member.summary: Class to sample a path from top to bottom.

member.param: The width of the underlying verticalGrid.
The height of the underlying verticalGrid
Random number generator
Optional function to specify some global constraints on the outflows of a row.

Function that returns true or false whether this row is desired. Parameters are: the pathID, the row number, the current candidate row value (vertical bits), all verticalBits so far, all horizontal bits so far, all components so far

member.name: T:CrawfisSoftware.PCG.LoopGeneratorSideWinder`2
member.summary: Generate a random loop on a grid that consists of two paths that merge at the bottom row and top row.

member.name: P:CrawfisSoftware.PCG.LoopGeneratorSideWinder`2.MaxSpanWidth
member.summary: Get or set the maximum horizontal passage length used in the default PickNextColumn function.

member.name: P:CrawfisSoftware.PCG.LoopGeneratorSideWinder`2.MinVerticalSpan
member.summary: Get or set the number of rows that should be vertical spans before any turns. This is used in the default PickNextColumn function.

member.name: P:CrawfisSoftware.PCG.LoopGeneratorSideWinder`2.MinLeftToRightSpacing
member.summary: Get or set the number of rows that should be vertical spans before any turns. This is used in the default PickNextColumn function.

member.name: P:CrawfisSoftware.PCG.LoopGeneratorSideWinder`2.PickNextColumns
member.summary: Get or set the a function to determine on a per row basis the exact column the curve should shift over to. Defaults to a random column to the left or right of the previous column at most MaxSpanWidth away.

member.name: P:CrawfisSoftware.PCG.LoopGeneratorSideWinder`2.IgnoreStartAndEnd
member.summary: Get or set whether to ignore the start and end cells when generating the maze.

member.name: P:CrawfisSoftware.PCG.LoopGeneratorSideWinder`2.ResetStartAndEnd
member.summary: Get or set whether to reset the start to the leftmost cell in the loop on the bottom row and the rightmost cell on the top row that are within the loop.

member.summary: Constructor
member.param: MazeBuilderAbstract to use.

Boolean indicating whether to reset the start to the leftmost cell in the loop on the bottom row and the end to the rightmost cell on the top row.

member.summary: Create a maze using the Sidewinder algorithm

member.name: T:CrawfisSoftware.PCG.MazeWrapperFromGridBitArrays`2
member.summary: Static class used to carve a path

member.name: M:CrawfisSoftware.PCG.MazeWrapperFromGridBitArrays`2.CarvePath(CrawfisSoftware.Collections.Maze.MazeBuilderAbstract{`0,`1},System.Collections.Generic.IList{System.Int32},System.Collections.Generic.IList{System.Int32})
member.summary: Carve openings based on the list of compressed vertical and horizontal edge flags for each row
member.param: An existing maze builder to use in the carving process
A list of rows, where each row has a bitpattern. 1's in the bit pattern indicate a passage should be carved to the next row (i,j)->(i,j+1). Bits are read right to left as the grid goes left to right.

A list of rows, where each row has a bitpattern. 1's in the bit pattern indicate a passage should be carved to the next cell (i,j)->(i+1,j). Bits are read right to left as the grid goes left to right.

member.name: M:CrawfisSoftware.PCG.MazeWrapperFromGridBitArrays`2.CarvePath(CrawfisSoftware.Collections.Maze.MazeBuilderAbstract{`0,`1},System.Collections.Generic.IList{System.Numerics.BigInteger},System.Collections.Generic.IList{System.Numerics.BigInteger})
member.summary: Carve openings based on the list of compressed vertical and horizontal edge flags for each row
member.param: An existing maze builder to use in the carving process
A list of rows, where each row has a bitpattern. 1's in the bit pattern indicate a passage should be carved to the next row (i,j)->(i,j+1). Bits are read right to left as the grid goes left to right.

A list of rows, where each row has a bitpattern. 1's in the bit pattern indicate a passage should be carved to the next cell (i,j)->(i+1,j). Bits are read right to left as the grid goes left to right.

member.name: T:CrawfisSoftware.PCG.OutflowState
member.summary: Enum of possible directions an inflow can go.

member.name: M:CrawfisSoftware.PCG.OutflowStates.OldDetermineOutflowStates(System.Collections.Generic.List{System.Int32},System.Collections.Generic.List{System.Int32})
member.summary: This method will eliminate invalid states between two inflows based on positions and components. All possible combinations can then be tried for each span So there would be 3^N possible state cases.
member.param: The positions of the inflows.
The component numbers of the inflows (after any merges).
member.returns: A vector of states flags.
member.remarks: The case of a single space between two inflows is not handled here. So the set of possibilities may be slightly less if positions[i]+2 == positions[i+1] as the combination go right (for i) and go left (for i+1) is invalid. This is handled in the span enumeration once we fix a state for inflow i.

member.name: M:CrawfisSoftware.PCG.OutflowStates.DetermineOutflowStates(System.Int32,System.Collections.Generic.List{System.Int32},System.Collections.Generic.List{System.Int32})
member.summary: Enumerate all rows that have the desired inflows and outflow states (left, up, right). All merges are marked with states dead-goes-right and dead-goes-left.
member.param: The width of the row.
The positions of the inflows.
List of component numbers for each position.
member.returns: An Enumerable of the valid row directions for each inflow position.

member.name: M:CrawfisSoftware.PCG.OutflowStates.DetermineOutflowStates(System.Int32,System.Collections.Generic.List{System.Int32})
member.summary: Enumerate all rows that have the desired inflows and outflow states (left, up, right). All merges are marked with states dead-goes-right and dead-goes-left.
member.param: The width of the row.
The positions of the inflows.
member.returns: An Enumerable of the valid row directions for each inflow position.

member.summary: Get or set the a function to determine on a per row basis the exact column the curve should shift over to. Defaults to a random column to the left or right of the previous column at most MaxSpanWidth away.

member.name: P:CrawfisSoftware.PCG.PathGeneratorSideWinder`2.PickNextRow
member.summary: Get or set the a function to determine on a per row basis the exact row the curve should move to after the span for that row is completed. Defaults to the next row (returns row+1).

member.name: T:CrawfisSoftware.PCG.RandomWalkMazeBuilder`2
member.summary: Graph builder using the Drunken Walk or Random Walk algorithm with multiple walkers.
member.typeparam: The type used for node labels
The type used for edge weights

member.name: P:CrawfisSoftware.PCG.RandomWalkMazeBuilder`2.PercentToCarve
member.summary: The main control parameter for the algorithm. Specifies new passages to open (carve). A value of zero provides no carving. A value of 1.0 will carve the entire grid. Note: If carving a partial maze already, this parameter is for any new carvings.

member.name: P:CrawfisSoftware.PCG.RandomWalkMazeBuilder`2.MaxWalkingDistance
member.summary: A safety parameter or a useful control parameter. The algorithm stops after MazWalkingDistance steps.

member.name: P:CrawfisSoftware.PCG.RandomWalkMazeBuilder`2.NumberOfWalkers
member.summary: The number of walkers to spawn (eventually). New walkers can be spawned at random locations during initialization or at an existing walker's location as the algorithm progresses. The later will carve out more open areas.

member.name: P:CrawfisSoftware.PCG.RandomWalkMazeBuilder`2.InitialNumberOfWalkers
member.summary: The number of initial walkers to spawn. Each walker will start at a random location.

member.name: P:CrawfisSoftware.PCG.RandomWalkMazeBuilder`2.favorForwardCarving
member.summary: If favorForwardCarving is true. A walker is more likely to walk in a straight line. This moves the walker further around the room. Setting to false provides less exploration of the grid and carves out a more open area.

member.name: M:CrawfisSoftware.PCG.RandomWalkMazeBuilder`2.#ctor(System.Int32,System.Int32,CrawfisSoftware.Collections.Graph.GetGridLabel{`0},CrawfisSoftware.Collections.Graph.GetEdgeLabel{`1})
member.summary: Constructor. All of the parameters are the same as the grid data type.
member.param: Number of nodes in the horizontal direction.
Number of nodes in the vertical direction.
A GetGridLabel delegate instance used to determine a node's label when queried.
A GetEdgeLabel delegate instance used to determine a edge's label when queried.

member.name: M:CrawfisSoftware.PCG.RandomWalkMazeBuilder`2.#ctor(CrawfisSoftware.Collections.Maze.MazeBuilderAbstract{`0,`1})
member.summary: Constructor, Takes an existing maze builder (derived from MazeBuilderAbstract) and copies the state over.
member.param: A maze builder

member.name: M:CrawfisSoftware.PCG.RandomWalkMazeBuilder`2.CreateMaze(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Main method where the algorithm is performed. Note: This could be called many times with all but the first passing in a value of true. New walkers would be spawned on each invocation.
member.param: If true, _occupied with existing values already set will not be affected.

member.name: T:CrawfisSoftware.PCG.SpanEnumeration
member.summary: Enumerate all valid path (or loop) fragments, given the desired outflow state of the last bit and the outflow start of the previous span (the start bit location).
member.remarks: Bit order for a span goes from right to left. N...0

member.summary: Constructor.

The ending bit location.
The end bit's OutflowState.

member.summary: Static class used to enumerate rows with an inFlow constraint.

member.summary: Point the pre-computed tables to odd tables.

member.summary: Point the pre-computed tables to even tables.

member.summary: Get the valid vertical outputs given a vertical input.

The inflow bits.

member.summary: Get the valid vertical outputs given a vertical input. Valid outputs must have an odd number of bits.

The inflow bits.

member.summary: Get the valid vertical outputs given a vertical input. Valid outputs must have an even number of bits.

The inflow bits.

member.summary: Create pre-computed tables for paths, which have an odd number of inflows.
member.param: The width of the row, cannot exceed 16.
member.exception: is less than or equal to 16.

member.name: M:CrawfisSoftware.PCG.ValidPathRowEnumerator.BuildEvenTables(System.Int32)
member.summary: Create pre-computed tables for loops, which have an even number of inflows.
member.param: The width of the row
member.exception: is less than or equal to 16.

member.summary: Create pre-computed tables for paths, which have an odd number of inflows.

Function that returns true if this outflow configuration is desirable.
member.exception: is less than or equal to 16.

member.name: M:CrawfisSoftware.PCG.ValidPathRowEnumerator.BuildEvenTablesWithConstraints(System.Int32,System.Func{System.Int32,System.Boolean})
